alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Greensville; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 6:38PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Greensville, southwestern Sussex, southern Dinwiddie and northeastern Brunswick Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 638 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of McKenney to 8 miles east of Alberta to near Lawrenceville. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dinwiddie, Emporia, McKenney, Purdy, Jarratt, Alberta, Stony Creek, Radium, Dewitt, Carson, Grizzard, Bufford Crossroads, Dolphin, Pleasant Shade, Wharfs Store, Cowie Corner, Edgerton, Butterworth, Rawlings and Reams. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
